meanings.meaning: 1. proclamation; official notice 内閣が触れを回した。The Cabinet sent round an official notice.
2. touch; contact Only applies to 触れ, Only applies to 触彼女は彼に赤ちゃんに触れさせなかった。She didn't let him touch her baby.
布令 【ふれ】、触 【ふれ】

1. to touch; to feel 何かが足に触れるのを感じた。I felt something touch my feet.
2. to touch (with) as 〜に手を触れる, 〜に口を触れる, etc.
3. to experience; to come in contact with; to perceive
4. to touch on (a subject); to allude to; to refer to; to mention; to bring up 彼の手紙はその事件にそれとなくふれている。His letter alludes to the event.
5. to be in conflict with; to violate (law, copyright, etc.); to infringe
6. to proclaim; to make known; to spread (e.g. a rumour)

meanings.meaning: 1. to annoy; to irritate; to cause offence; to provoke; to get on someone's nerves
癪にさわる 【しゃくにさわる】、しゃくに障る 【しゃくにさわる】、癪に触る 【しゃくにさわる】
癪に触る: Irregular kanji usage.
1. to develop a rash or inflammation (e.g. in response to a skin irritant); to react to (something) Usually written using kana aloneツタウルシにかぶれました。I got a rash from poison ivy.
2. to be strongly influenced (usu. negative or critical nuance) Usually written using kana alone

sentences.translation: I got a rash from poison ivy.
